most_active_tickets.title: Delete chat bubbles breaks the onhover chat menu's appearance

common_issues.title: Deleting chat bubbles breaks hover menu on grouped bubbles
common_issues.description: Deleting a chat bubble (not the latest) causes remaining bubbles to group, and the hover menu only appears on the latest bubble in the group. This occurs on macOS desktop application version 11.4.4.  This appears to be a UI regression.

related_issues.title: Delete chat bubbles breaks the onhover chat menu's appearance
related_issues.text:
Delete chat bubbles breaks the onhover chat menu's appearance
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

This isn't a big one but looks like a minor UI regression. 

In a nutshell, deleting some part of the conversation then means you lose the ability to reach the hover menu on all chat bubbles.

If you delete any chat bubble other than the latest one of its kind ("assistant" or "user" kind) in a conversation then the remaining chat bubbles will get grouped, and you lose hover menu options on each-but-the-latest bubble in that group.


Steps:

- Open or start a conversation that has a long enough chain of prompts and responses
- Delete any chat bubble that is not the latest assistant or user bubble.
- Hover over the newly "grouped" bubbles and you should see the chat hover menu only appears appended to the latest bubble in that group
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the issue: "Deleting chat bubbles breaks hover menu on grouped bubbles" as it affects macOS desktop application users. Investigate the related issue (ID 750) and its reproduction steps to understand the root cause and develop a fix.

Given the UI regression, allocate resources to test the chat bubble deletion functionality across different operating systems and application versions to ensure the issue is isolated to macOS and version 11.4.4.

Improve the support documentation or FAQs with instructions on how to manage chat bubbles and address potential issues related to deleting them. This can help reduce future support tickets on the same topic.

Monitor incoming support tickets for similar UI regressions or issues related to chat bubbles to identify any recurring problems or trends. This will help proactively address potential issues and improve the user experience.
Consider implementing automated UI testing to catch regressions like this earlier in the development process. This can help prevent issues from reaching production and impacting users.
